name: Launches — 100-year trends: count & mass

content.markdown:
# {launch_count} Launches from {countries} Countries

### {launch_days} Years of Rocketry

Source: [GCAT](https://planet4589.org/space/gcat/index.html) Release 1.7.3 (2025 Apr 16) | Data Update 2025 Aug 5 
Click on items to filter and interact. Click edit in top right to customize dashboard.
content.query: SELECT launch_count, count(site.state_code) as countries, date_diff(min(launch_date), current_date(), year) as launch_days, min(launch_date) as min_date;

1.content:
import launch;

where
  launch_date between date_add( current_date(), YEAR, -100) and current_date()
select
  launch_year,

    sum(orb_pay) as total_payload_tons,
  launch_count,

  # avg(count(launch.id)) over order by year rows between 4 preceding and current row as launch_count_5yr_ma,
  # avg(sum(payload.mass_kg)) over order by year rows between 4 preceding and current row as mass_5yr_ma,
  # sum(count(launch.id)) over order by year asc as launch_count_cumulative,
  # sum(sum(payload.mass_kg)) over order by year asc as total_payload_mass_kg_cumulative
order by
  launch_year asc
limit 2000;
1.name: Annual launches and payload mass (dual axis)

2.content:
where
  launch_date >= date_add(current_date(), year, -100)
select
  # site.code,
  site.name,
  site.latitude as lat,
  site.longitude as lon,
  site.state_code,

  sum(orb_pay) as payload_tons,
  launch_count,
  min(launch_date) as first_launch_date,
  max(launch_date) as last_launch_date
order by
  launch_count desc
limit 1000;
2.name: Launch sites map — mass and counts

3.content:
# generate a breakdown of mass to orby by rocket family
where orb_pay is not null
select
  vehicle_label,
  launch_count_by_label,
  tonnes_by_label,
  vehicle.leo_capacity,
 round(case
    when launch_count = 0 then null
    else (sum(orb_pay)) / launch_count
  end*100)/100 as avg_launch_tons
having
   vehicle.leo_capacity>0
   and tonnes_by_label>0
order by
tonnes_by_label desc
 limit 40
;
3.name: By rocket: launch (attempts) and mass

4.content:
where orb_pay is not null
select
  site.state_code,
  # site.name as launch_site,
  -- sum(orb_pay)::int as total_payload,
  log(CASE WHEN total_payload = 0 then 1 else total_payload END, 10) as log_scale_orbital_tons,
  launch_count
order by
  log_scale_orbital_tons desc
limit 15;
4.name: Launch Site Country - Mass and Count

7.content:
where orb_pay is not null
select
  site.state_code,
  site.name,
  total_orbital_payload_tonnes,
  launch_count
order by
  total_orbital_payload_tonnes desc
limit 15;
7.name: Table 7

9.content:
select
launch_filter,
#launch_count
order by launch_filter asc
;
9.name: Launch Type Filter (Shift-click for multiple)

content.markdown:
# {vehicle_label} ({vehicle_family})
The top launcher by mass of {all_vehicles} in filter set with {total_mass} tons to {launch_targets} in {launch_count} ({successful_launches} successful) launch attempts.

## Stats
- **Length**: {vehicle_length} meters
- **Diameter**: {vehicle_diameter} meters
- **LEO Capacity**: {vehicle_leo_capacity} Kgs
- **Launch Mass**: {vehicle_launch_mass} tonnes
- **Launch Thrust**: {vehicle_to_thrust} kN

Special Orbit Codes:
- LSS - non ISS space station
content.query:
SELECT
    vehicle.name,
    vehicle.class,
    vehicle.variant,
    vehicle.length,
    vehicle.leo_capacity,
    vehicle_label,
    launch_count,
    count(filter launch_tag where was_complete_success is not null) -> successful_launches,
    count(filter launch_tag where success_flag = 'E') -> pad_aborts,
    count(vehicle.family) by __preql_internal.all_rows -> all_vehicles,
    vehicle.family,
    vehicle.launch_mass,
    vehicle.to_thrust,
    vehicle.diameter,
    round(sum(orb_pay),2) -> total_mass,
    array_to_string(array_distinct(array_agg(launch_filter)),', ') -> launch_targets,
ORDER BY
    total_mass desc
LIMIT 1
;

11.content:
select
launch_state_flag,
#launch_count
order by launch_state_flag asc
;
11.name: Launch Org (click title to clear)

12.content:
select 

   payload_label,
      --  vehicle.name,
    orbit_code,
    payload.jcat.count as payload_count,
    --rank vehicle.name order by sum(orb_pay) by vehicle.name desc  as vehicle_rank
having
    vehicle_rank = 1
limit 50;
12.name: Launcher Top 50 Payloads

content.markdown:
### Launch Site Country
Does not always match the country of the launching organization.

description: Explore 100 years of space launches — trends in launch count and payload mass, where launches happen, which rockets and countries contributed most, and the recent launch log. Use the time series to see long-term trends; click a launch site on the map to focus rockets and country views; click a rocket or country bar to see its timeline and recent launches in the table.
